titleStmt.title: H. S. Wright et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9034

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his excellancy
Gov. J, F, Robinson
Your petitioners would state that at the August term of the Carroll Circut Court Jas. S Clark was fined the sum of 20$ & cost for gaming.

The circumstances were these, in passing by where men were gaming and being young and somewhat intoxicated at the time was bantered to play and did so to the amount of 25 cents and then quit the game, -- Your petitioners beleive his case one deserving executive clemency, and pray you to remit the same as we do not beleive he will engage in anything of the kind again.

Your petitioners would further state that said Clark declined a defence upon the ground that he was guilty
to the extent stated above, and therefore would not plead not guilty.

H, S, Wright
P,, Hemdley
Jesse Lee
R King
W L Ringo
James Humprey
R, S, Luckett.
A W Darling
B B Elston

Jas S. Clarke
Pettn
Refused
J F R --
